intro: Cheiridopsis inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Cheiridopsis inaequalis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
